question: Question_01_(a)
statement:
Consider the system of equations in the variables
\emph{x}\textsubscript{1}, \emph{x}\textsubscript{2},
\emph{x}\textsubscript{3}:

\begin{align*}
&x_1 + 2x_2 + 3x_3 &= 1\\
&x_1 + x_2 + 2x_3 &= 2\\
&2x_1 + 3x_2 + (5+t)x_3 &= 2
\end{align*} Determine all the values of \emph{t} for which the system
is consistent.
sols:
We can write this system in matrix form:

\[\left[ \begin{array}{ccc}
1 & 2 & 3 \\
1 & 1 & 2 \\
2 & 3 & 5+t
\end{array} \right] \left[ \begin{array}{c}
x_1 \\
x_2 \\
x_3
\end{array} \right] = \left[ \begin{array}{c}
1 \\
2 \\
2
\end{array} \right]\]

To know if the system is consistent, we want to look at the row reduced
form of the augmented matrix.

First, perform the operations L\textsubscript{2} →
L\textsubscript{2}-L\textsubscript{1} and L\textsubscript{3} →
L\textsubscript{3}-2L\textsubscript{1}

\[\left[ \begin{array}{cccc}
1 & 2 & 3 & 1 \\
1 & 1 & 2 & 2 \\
2 & 3 & 5+t & 2
\end{array} \right]  \sim \left[ \begin{array}{cccc}
1 & 2 & 3 & 1 \\
0 & -1 & -1 & 1 \\
0 & -1 & -1+t & 0
\end{array} \right]\] Then, perform L\textsubscript{2} →
(-1)L\textsubscript{2}

\[\sim \left[ \begin{array}{cccc}
1 & 2 & 3 & 1 \\
0 & 1 & 1 & -1 \\
0 & -1 & -1+t & 0
\end{array} \right]\] Perform L\textsubscript{3} →
L\textsubscript{3}+L\textsubscript{2}

\[\sim \left[ \begin{array}{cccc}
1 & 2 & 3 & 1 \\
0 & 1 & 1 & -1 \\
0 & 0 & t & -1
\end{array} \right]\]

If we read the last row of this matrix, we obtain the equation

\[\displaystyle
tx_3 = -1\]

The system is inconsistent if \emph{t} = 0 since that would give us the
equation 0 = -1. Hence the system is consistent for all non-zero values
of \emph{t}.
hints:
Writing this system in matrix form, what will tell you whether the
system is consistent or not?

A linear system of three equations is consistent if it has a solution
(\emph{x}\textsubscript{1}, \emph{x}\textsubscript{2},
\emph{x}\textsubscript{3}).
